Posted By: Mylon (1/17/2010 11:59:28 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Stupidly, ridiculously good spell, especially for common, and if you can get off multiples in the first few turns then it'll probably be game. It's [Lava Spike](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lava Spike) glued to [Mind Rot](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Rot), and that 2-for-1 convenience somehow equates to costing one mana LESS. This is the lovely little lady that makes Jund the force it is, and a [Bloodbraid Elf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodbraid Elf) towing one of these along is probably the best use of 2RG that has ever been. Really great card, just all-around awesome, and not playing it in a B/R deck these days is all but inexcusable. Go get yourself a playset; it's common and cheap. 5/5
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
The power of Jund:  
[Bituminous blast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bituminous blast) into [bloodbraid elf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=bloodbraid elf) into [blightning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=blightning), swing with [bloodbraid elf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=bloodbraid elf).  
10 damage and discard two cards, good sir.  
and on turn 5, that usually wins.  
That's why they call a double cascade "living the dream." :)
posts.html:
The power of Jund:
Bituminous blast into bloodbraid elf into blightning, swing with bloodbraid elf.
10 damage and discard two cards, good sir.
and on turn 5, that usually wins.
That's why they call a double cascade "living the dream." :)
